levelledPara.title: Frame Assembly Performance Test Procedure
levelledPara.para: This data module describes the performance test procedure for the Center Body Frame Assembly (53-10-50).

levelledPara.title: Test Objectives
levelledPara.para: To verify that the Frame Assembly meets all structural performance requirements, including load transfer capability, joint integrity, and resistance to combined loading conditions.

levelledPara.title: Prerequisites
levelledPara.para: Before performing this test, ensure the following conditions are met:

listItem.para: Frame assembly is properly installed and aligned per installation procedures
All joints and connections are properly fastened to design specifications
Test equipment is calibrated and operational
Safety precautions are in place

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Ensure all personnel are clear of the test area before applying loads. Frame failure could result in rapid load release.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Monitor joint connections continuously during loading for any signs of movement or failure.

levelledPara.title: Required Test Equipment
levelledPara.para: The following test equipment is required:

listItem.para: Multi-axis load frame capable of applying combined loads
Strain gauges and data acquisition system with minimum 32 channels
3D displacement measurement system (photogrammetry or laser tracking)
Load cells at each loading point
Torque monitoring system for joint connections
Verify that all prerequisites have been met.
Install strain gauges at designated measurement points on frame members and joints.
Set up 3D displacement measurement system and establish baseline geometry.
Apply preload of 10 kN in vertical direction to stabilize the assembly.
Perform single-axis tests: Apply loads incrementally in 20 kN steps up to design load in vertical, lateral, and longitudinal directions separately.
Record strain, displacement, and load data at each increment.
Perform combined loading test: Apply simultaneous loads in multiple directions per design load case matrix.
Hold at maximum test load for 5 minutes for each load case.
Unload incrementally, recording data at each decrement.
Perform visual and dimensional inspection for any signs of damage, permanent deformation, or joint slippage.
Check torque on all critical fasteners to verify no loss of preload.

levelledPara.title: Acceptance Criteria
levelledPara.para: The Frame Assembly passes the performance test if:

listItem.para: No visible cracks, joint failure, fastener yielding, or permanent deformation observed
Maximum recorded strain is within design allowables for all load cases
Maximum displacement is within specified limits for each direction
Permanent set after unloading is less than 0.1 mm at any measurement point
No joint slippage or rotation observed
Fastener torque loss is less than 5% of original torque
Load transfer paths function as designed with no unexpected load redistribution

levelledPara.title: Data Recording
levelledPara.para: Record all test data in the approved test report form. Include:

listItem.para: Date, time, and test personnel
Frame assembly serial number and configuration
Test equipment identification and calibration dates
All load, strain, and displacement measurements for each load case
Before and after fastener torque measurements
Photographic documentation of critical areas
Pass/fail determination and signatures
